nodes.description: "TNFSF4, also known as OX40L, is a tumor necrosis factor ligand superfamily member 4 that encodes a T cell costimulatory molecule called OX40 ligand, and is associated with autoimmune diseases like SLE and systemic sclerosis."

"Systemic sclerosis, also referred to as SSc, is an autoimmune disease that leads to the development of cutaneous and visceral fibrosis."<SEP>"Systemic sclerosis, an autoimmune disease characterized by fibrosis, involves sclerosis of the skin and internal organs."

"An autoimmune disease linked with PTPN22 and STAT4 genes."<SEP>"Systemic lupus erythematosus is an autoimmune disease with diverse manifestations including skin rashes, joint pain, and organ involvement."<SEP>"Systemic lupus erythematosus, also referred to as SLE, is an autoimmune disease for which TNFSF4 is a susceptibility gene."

"Fibrosis involves excessive deposition of extracellular matrix proteins, leading to tissue scarring."<SEP>"Fibrosis is a pathological condition involving excessive tissue scarring, a notable feature of systemic sclerosis."<SEP>"Fibrosis is characterized by pathological scarring and thickening of connective tissue, often seen in systemic sclerosis affecting both skin and internal organs."<SEP>"Fibrosis is the thickening and scarring of connective tissue, often a result of systemic sclerosis."<SEP>"Fibrosis refers to pathological scarring, often a symptom in diseases like systemic sclerosis."<SEP>"Fibrosis refers to the thickening and scarring of connective tissue, a common feature in systemic sclerosis."<SEP>"Fibrosis, a hallmark of systemic sclerosis, involves the thickening and scarring of connective tissues."
